sub_title:
Drinkable Rivers;
Founder Spring College; university teacher; watershed mobiliser; professional walker
summary:
Hello, my name is Li An Phoa. I am happy to connect with you. I mobilise watersheds, create learning experiences and initiate innovative landscape projects. With my dream of Drinkable Rivers as indicators of healthy living, I mobilise people for water and whole healthy and thriving ecosystems.Summer 2018, I walked 1061km from the source of the River Meuse to the Northsea for Drinkable Rivers. I am a university teacher (ecology, business, philosophy) at the Nyenrode Business School and at the Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University (taught outdoor master electives 'Sustainability Grand Challenges: Polluted Rivers' and ‘Companies in Ecologies’). I share my vision on ecology and economy with my nomadic school, Spring College. I collaborate with organisations such as Triodos, EPAMA, Waterschap Brabantse Delta, WaterNatuurlijk, C40, Unilever, the Province of Gelderland and the Rwandan Ministry of Health, as well as with innovative farmers, artists and indigenous communities.

Keywords: Watershed Mobiliser, System Thinker & Doer, Holistic Learning, Drinkable Rivers, Innovation, Business Responsibility, Research Sustainable Food Systems & Landscapes, Creation, Multi-stakeholder processes, Wilderness

Actions: connecting, initiating, writing, learning & teaching, creating, organising, walking, hiking and gardening, speaking.

Now almost none. I long for a world where rivers are drinkable. If we have Drinkable Rivers (CC), it means that all relations in an entire watershed will be healthy. I am on a mission towards ‘Drinkable Rivers, as indicator for healthy ways of living.’ To address this, I will walk rivers from source-to-sea. I will start with the river Maas, as I was born next to a tributary of the Maas.
